space_address: Alam Damai, 56000 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
space_description_content: A public park located at the end of the Bandar Tun Razak parliamentary constituency which borders the Hulu Langat district. The 23.4 -acre park has a hilly and terraced topography. Therefore, to ensure the stability of the existing slope, the development of the landscape maintains a minimal and natural concept while providing passive and active recreational facilities for visitors.

space_address: Perdana Botanical Gardens, 50480 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
space_description_content: Perdana Botanical Gardens, formerly Perdana Lake Gardens, Lake Gardens, and Public Gardens, is Kuala Lumpur's first large-scale recreational park. Measuring 91.6 hectares (226 acres), it is located in the heart of the city and established in 1888. The park served as place of refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city during colonial times. It contains large sculpted and manicured gardens and a host of attractions.

space_address: Changkat Abang Haji Openg, Bukit Kiara, 60000 Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
space_description_content: Bukit Kiara is an affluent suburb of Kuala Lumpur, containing some of the city’s nicer homes, a golf course, and an equestrian center. A highlight is Bukit Kiara Park, one of the larger green spaces in the city. There are some roads, trails popular with mountain bikers, and walking/hiking trails. The area is fairly hilly.

space_address: Bukit Kerinchi, 59200 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
space_description_content: Taman Rimba Bukit Kerinchi is a popular park located southwest of the city center, attracting locals for picnics, barbecues, and camping. The hill, known as Bukit Gasing in some areas and Bukit Kerinchi in KL, offers different experiences based on the entrance used. The well-maintained walking trails provide serene forest views and a cool environment with minimal crowds.

This area is a natural area where there is a former mine pond and an open area that is now planted with flowers and shade trees.

space_address: 115, Jalan Ampang Hilir, Desa Pahlawan, 55000 Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
space_description_content:
Taman Tasik Ampang Hilir covers a total area of ​​16 hectares with a lake area of ​​12 hectares. The development of Taman Tasik Ampang Hilir is based on the Concept of Sustainable Development which provides recreational and leisure facilities that integrate with the environment for the public around Ampang, Kg. Pandan and nearby areas. In addition, this area also provides a variety of facilities that can meet the needs of either active or passive groups for the elderly, youth and including children.
For those who want to hold 'indoor' activities, this park provides a hall that provides sports facilities such as badminton and netball. This hall is also open for those who want to hold public events such as weddings and social activities as well.

space_address: 78, Jln Abang Haji Openg, Taman Tun Dr Ismail, 60000 Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
space_description_content: Federal Park, Bukit Kiara Large-Scale Public Park is a living museum that serves as the location of major trees, shrubs and cover crops.  Woody forest trees and equatorial rainforest support crops will be planted according to the natural forest-based landscape architectural design.

space_address: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, 50050 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur
space_description_content: Freedom Lawn Area KL, located in the south of Independence Square, holds historical significance as it marks Malaysia's freedom from colonialism. The park area is vast and well-maintained, offering a lush green space behind the Sultan Abdul Samad Building. It's a great spot for relaxation and photo opportunities with iconic buildings in the backdrop. The best time to visit is in the evening to enjoy both day and night views.

space_address: No. 2, Jalan P.Ramlee, 50250, Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan, 50250 Kuala Lumpur
space_description_content: Set in the heart of Kuala Lumpur's bustling city centre, one can now discover the enchanting KL Forest Eco Park, a verdant oasis concealed amidst an urban sprawl. The dimensions of this park encompasses 9.3 hectares, also serving as a lush habitat for an array of wildlife species. Amongst some notable fauna include the Silver Leaf Monkeys and Long-Tailed Macaques, both of which have found comfort and refuge within its rich confines.

space_address: Bukit Kiara Trail 2, Bukit Kiara, 60000 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur
space_description_content: Waterfall Point, Bukit Kiara Forest is a charming spot for nature enthusiasts. The trail offers a chance to spot native wildlife amidst lush forests, culminating at the Bukit Kiara waterfall. Visitors may encounter crested goshawks, oriental hornbills, black orioles, and brown shirks along the way. While not a towering cascade, the cute and cool waterfall is perfect for a refreshing dip.

space_address: Perdana Botanical Gardens, 50480 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
space_description_content: Aside from the gardens, the Perdana Botanical Gardens are highly frequented due to their proximity to some of KL’s most notable landmarks, including the Islamic Arts Museum Malaysia, the National Monument, and the National Planetarium.

space_address: East, Lot 201064, Jalan Melati Kuarza 3, 53100 Kuala Lumpur
space_description_content: Enter and be transported to another world at KL East Park. A naturally regenerating secondary rainforest spanning 53 acres, it is part of the Bukit Tabur and the Klang Gates Quartz Ridge network. A place of untold riches, this biodiverse park is home to rare, endemic species and beautiful geological formations found nowhere else.

space_address: Taman Botani Perdana, 50480 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur
space_description_content: The Bamboo Playhouse is a public pavilion located in Kuala Lumpur’s oldest and arguably, most picturesque park – the Perdana Botanical Gardens. The park is located right in the heart of the capital city and is very popular with locals and tourists. The pavilion itself is situated on a small island in a large lake that stretches through the centre of the park. The use of bamboo in contemporary buildings is very rare in Malaysia and this building explores its potential as a sustainable building material.

space_address: Jalan 11/36, Taman Sri Bintang, 52200 Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur
space_description_content: The Sri Bintang Hill Trallis a popular hiking spot for the residents around the area of Bukit Sri Bintang. Although it is not as wellknown as other hiking spots in kl, such as Bukit Gasing or Apek Hil,there are always a good number of hikers around. it is a smalarea to explore with relatively easy hiking trails. While there are straightforward main paths to reach the peaks, you can alsoexplore different subroutes and even loops, as there gre many split paths in the ared
space_family_content: Good for kids, Kid-friendly hikes, Playground

space_address: Jalan Ketumbar, Taman Cheras, 56100 Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur
space_description_content: Ketumbar Hill is a modest sized hill of around 300 metres above sea level in the Cheras area of Kuala Lumpur. The hill is part of a stretch of forest reserve which also includes Bukit Apek and Bukit Saga. Its location catches the breezes which help to make the hike more enjoyable. This is a popular hiking spot for nearby residents, especially in the early mornings, late afternoons and at weekends. Community-spirited hikers have set up a ‘Jungle Gym’ in a clearing near the top of the hill complete with improvised exercise equipment.
space_family_content: Good for kids, Kid-friendly hikes, Playground
